intro: Helictochloa blaui subsp. aenigmatica, commonly known as the Bluegrass Needlegrass, is a grass species native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fine, grass-like blades and compact growth habit, often forming dense mats. The plant has narrow, blue-green leaves with a distinct sheath and is typically found in moist, well-drained soils. It is a perennial species, often growing in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native grassland ecosystems.
